data.title: Top notch food and service.
data.text: From the moment we entered Rick's Press Room we knew we were in for a treat and the meal assured our expectation.

data.title: Best diner in Meridian Idaho
data.text:
this spot is a hidden gem, the owners wait on the tables and prepare the food. incredible menu, and it shows. high quality food and an excellent dining experience. 
I recommend the Salmon BLT for lunch and the Pork chops for dinner, but everything on the menu is top shelf.

data.title: Great spot for a relaxing meal
data.text: Stayed the night near here on a road trip down to Death Valley. Stopped in and had a couple beers and a burger. The burger was great and i'd definitely recommend. The place had a cool, relaxed vibe. Pretty quiet when I went - though it was on a weeknight. Didn't realize until I was almost done with my meal that this place was featured on Diners, Drive-ins, and Dives. It was the first DDD spot that I have stumbled across.

data.title: Yummy!
data.text: We love Rick's and his food! The food is so delious and the staff is very friendly. The atmosphere very fun too!  It is wonderful for great private parties.  They closed for my 50th birthday party and the guests raved on long after about the wonderful food! Thanks Rick's for being such a wonderful place in Meridian!

data.title: Average food. Average help. Average experience.
data.text: Went here after seeing them on a Food Network show. Was in for lunch AFTER the "lunch rush" about 1PM. Kitchen was overworked. Wait staff overworked and not prompt. Food was average. I understand the family-run type business, but at some point, you need more than one person waiting tables. The sandwich was decent, but nothing noteworthy, nor worth the price. I don't think I'd recommend this restaurant to neighbors unless there weren't any others in the near vicinity. Pains me to post a less-than-stellar review of a one-off restaurant, because I like these as opposed to chains, but Rick's is just average.

data.title: Leisure lunch
data.text: The soup was amazing. Several trips to Ricks and always the same outcome. Great food and too full.  But of course I'll be back. :)

data.title: Yep, a dive. But great food!!
data.text: We saw Rick's on DDD and always wanted to try it. The specialty is the potatoe crusted salmon yet we were in the mood for sandwiches. We visited during lunch and for an out of the way place off the main Meridian drag, it was busy during the mid week. There was only one staff member manning the restaurant and bar yet she handled it efficiently and friendly. My Philly cheese steak was huge, hot, and delicious. The bread is artisan and the fries hot and crispy. My DH had the lunch special chicken sandwich and he raved about his as well. Good house wine and really fun atmosphere with writing and pictures all over the walls. We are glad we finally made it in to Rick's and plan on coming back for dinner to try the rib eye and salmon.

data.title: Good food and ok BBQ.
data.text: Went with some friends on the recommendation for their all you can eat BBQ.  It was OK and I have had better BBQ.  Atmosphere is pretty cool and owners are friendly. I don't recommend the BBQ as I think they probably have better things in the menu.

data.title: Real Homemade food!
data.text: The restaurant is a small hometown cafe off of Main Street run by a husband and wife.  The food was fresh, delicious and definitely homemade.  We had the Tuna melt with a bowl of soup.  Today's soup special was a Mexican pozole and it was delicious, as was the tuna melt.  The menu includes soup, salads, burgers, sandwiches as well as several specialty items.  Atmosphere is casual and clean.  Hours for lunch are Tues-Friday only and dinner is served Tuesday - Saturday.  Will definitely return.

data.title: Delicious surprise
data.text:
I like to try different restaurants all the time. Often it seems the menus are all the same; burgers or salads. To my delight the menu at Rick's Press Room was full of tasty new entree's you're sure love. I went there for lunch and had the Thai chicken wrap. The portion was huge and the flavor was great. I've already got plans to return for dinner next week.
A quick note; their hours are a little different since they close for a few hours between lunch and dinner. Just look at their website to make sure they're open when you're going. But don't miss it, you won't be disappointed.

data.title: Good burgers and cold beer! in Meridian
data.text: We stopped in here one day on a recommendation. We were so glad we did. I had a press room Burger and it was great. My wif3e had Ricks Tuna Melt and she said it was delicious. They also feature  a big variety of sandwiches. they are only open Tuesday thru Friday from 11:30 to 2:30. They are closed on Sunday and Mondays. Great food and great service.

data.title: Great food fun environment
data.text: I really enjoyed my visit there the food and the choices on the burgers were awesome great service with a nice open-air environment similar to a patio dining experience. Nice wait staff as well they accept reservations even though they were not needed for a lunch meeting on a weekday

data.title: Homemade food, friendly service
data.text:
Rick's is probably one of if not my favorite restaurant in the whole valley. We go for lunch quite a bit, the Meatloaf sandwich is amazing. And have also done dinner, Porkchops, 2 thumbs up!

Rick does an outstanding job, all the food is fresh, not frozen and you can tell, it is good home cooking!

data.title: Best tiramisu ever!
data.text: We try to visit Triple D places when we travel and found Rick's on this trip. I had to try the potatoe salmon, which was wonderful.  I couldn't resist the house special of flaming tiramisu and it didn't disappoint. My husband, who usually doesn't like tiramisu, loved it and might have converted. We decided there are too many things on the menu that sound good, so we are going back tomorrow!  Service was slow, only one waitress, who decided to bus tables before helping us. There were at least 15 clean tables, so we couldn't understand the delayed service, in the end, it was worth the wait.

data.title: Food was tasty and a fun place to dine
data.text: The locals will probably not want you to know about this place. The food was great and the location was fun!

data.title: A nice place w/ good food
data.text: The ambience doesn't fit the style of food they serve. They definitely are great on the food presentation and their halibut special today was delicious, but the filet mignon my husband had was ok. When I first saw the place I assumed I'd be getting the typical burger, fish n chips etc. but they actually serve high end meals for almost high end prices, minus the waiting server & dining ambience. I wouldn't exactly recommend this place for a date. It's pretty loud. It won't give you any romantic feels at all. Anyway, I really appreciated them accommodating my beverage request; since they didn't have strawberry lemonade, they made me blackberry instead. All in all, it's worth the money, but I hope to see improvements on the actual dining experience.

data.title: Best Western Reuben in the PNW?
data.text: This is a quality establishment with excellent service.  They have gotten to be a little trendy the last few years but it's worth wading through the crowd to get your hands on one of their Reubens.  They are of the mustard variety and simply fantastic.

data.title: Great food, understaffed "front of house"
data.text: The food is amazing (and worth the wait) but visitors may be turned off by the understaffed "front of the house".  One person performs to serve all tables and cover the bar service.  Too much for anyone to handle alone (although she tries very hard - without complaint).

data.title: Quick dinner
data.text: Don't blink cause you will miss this place.   It has a garage type front door that can be raised for nice days.  And it was a nice day!  The inside walls are covered in graffiti left by previous customers so the decor is a bit bare.  The only issue I had was the smoke shop next door.  The cigar and cigarette smoke was noticeable when the wind blew in our direction.   Luckily we were sitting with the garage door up.  Service was prompt and friendly.  Orders were taken without delay.  The salmon and potatoes was as good as advertised.  Kudos to the chef.  Another must visit in Idaho.

data.title: not up to all the hype
data.text:
after going to our weekly movie we wanted to try this place, saw all the reviews, looked wonderful, well we should have looked for some other place.  as some of the pther people wrote, we showed up at 6 30 pm, stood at the front door for atleast 15 minutes, we were not seated and there were lots of open tables, finally got a table and sat there for about one half hour before we even cot a menu or a glass of water. another 10 minutes and our order was taken. it came out quite fast, as it was the chicken breast special and meatloaf. the many is very limited, the dinners were just ok, not awesome like other readers have said, over priced as well, picked out some wine off the wall , it was ok,, got the bill of $60 and nothing was itemized , even the wine we have no idea how much it was. 
we will not do this place again !!
